channel.title: Nature - Quantum
channel.description: Recent articles from Nature, Nature Physics, and Nature Photonics on Quantum Simulation.

item.title: Strongly interacting Meissner phases in large bosonic flux ladders
item.content:encoded: The quantum simulation of driven, strongly correlated phases at large scales is challenging, primarily due to detrimental heating effects. Now, a large-scale interacting Mott–Meissner phase has been realized in a neutral atom quantum simulator.
item.author: Alexander Impertro, SeungJung Huh, Monika Aidelsburger

item.title: Hamiltonian engineering of collective XYZ spin models in an optical cavity
item.content:encoded: Spin models that can be emulated by quantum simulators are usually restricted to systems with conserved total magnetization. The tuning of photon-mediated interactions between atoms in a cavity enables the implementation of more general models also useful for quantum sensing tasks.
item.author: Chengyi Luo, Haoqing Zhang, James K. Thompson

item.title: Continuous recoil-driven lasing and cavity frequency pinning with laser-cooled atoms
item.content:encoded: Experiments with cold atoms in optical cavities are often limited to discontinuous operation due to reloading requirements. Now, continuous lasing is demonstrated with strontium atoms in a ring cavity, stabilized by atom loss mechanisms.
item.author: Vera M. Schäfer, Zhijing Niu, James K. Thompson

item.title: Resourceful dissipation
item.content:encoded: Controlled dissipation enables the extraction of equilibrium properties of ultracold one-dimensional gases through the observation of anomalous dynamics.
item.author: Yann Kiefer

item.title: Simulating two-dimensional lattice gauge theories on a qudit quantum computer
item.content:encoded: Qubit-based simulations of gauge theories are challenging as gauge fields require high-dimensional encoding. Now a quantum electrodynamics model has been demonstrated using trapped-ion qudits, which encode information in multiple states of ions.
item.author: Michael Meth, Jinglei Zhang, Martin Ringbauer

item.title: Deterministic remote entanglement using a chiral quantum interconnect
item.content:encoded: Large quantum computers are likely to require methods of connecting devices by transmitting and absorbing photons. Entanglement between two superconducting qubit devices has now been established using a waveguide with tunable directionality.
item.author: Aziza Almanakly, Beatriz Yankelevich, William D. Oliver

item.title: Author Correction: Observation of Nagaoka polarons in a Fermi–Hubbard quantum simulator
item.author: Martin Lebrat, Muqing Xu, Markus Greiner

item.title: Orbital hybridization in graphene-based artificial atoms
item.content:encoded: Orbital hybridization in artificial atoms is achieved by altering their shape, and the anisotropy of the confining potential gives rise to the hybridization between quasibound states with different orbital quantum numbers within the artificial atom.
item.author: Yue Mao, Hui-Ying Ren, Qing-Feng Sun

item.title: Thermalization and criticality on an analogue–digital quantum simulator
item.content:encoded: A hybrid analogue–digital quantum simulator is used to demonstrate beyond-classical performance in benchmarking experiments and to study thermalization phenomena in an XY quantum magnet, including the breakdown of Kibble–Zurek scaling predictions and signatures of the Kosterlitz–Thouless phase transition.
item.author: T. I. Andersen, N. Astrakhantsev, X. Mi

item.title: Quantum coarsening and collective dynamics on a programmable simulator
item.content:encoded: A programmable quantum simulator based on Rydberg atom arrays is used to study the collective dynamics of a quantum phase transition and observe the phenomenon of quantum coarsening.
item.author: Tom Manovitz, Sophie H. Li, Mikhail D. Lukin
